intro: Crithodium urartu, commonly known as the Armenian thornsteppe, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of the Caucasus. It belongs to the grass family Poaceae and is characterized by its tufted growth habit and spikelet-bearing inflorescences. The plant typically grows in dry, rocky habitats and is adapted to cold, high-altitude environments. Its leaves are narrow and often have a bluish-gray hue, which helps reduce water loss. Crithodium urartu plays a role in stabilizing soil in its native habitat and is of interest to botanists studying alpine flora.
